sentences.sentence: She jocularly divided her life into "before stroke" and "after stroke", like BC and AD.
sentences.translation: 她幽默地把生活分成“中风前”和“中风后”，就像“公元前”和“公元后”。

sentences.sentence: When he was quite gone, the other traveler descended from the tree, and accosting his friend, jocularly inquired"what it was the Bear had whispered in your ear?"
sentences.translation: 当它走后，另一个旅客从树上下来，然后和他的朋友打招呼。诙谐地问道：“刚才那只熊对你说了什么?。

sentences.sentence: Against his wishes, he and Captus were sent to a much grimmer establishment, which the author jocularly calls Hotel California, in a desolate part of what is clearly Afghanistan.
sentences.translation: 接着，上级违背他的愿望，强行把他和卡普塔斯遣送到一个更阴森的地方，书中作者幽默的称之为“加州旅馆”；显然，这就是阿富汗的某个无人区。
